programme.title: Cold Case Files
programme.desc: Just after the last day of school in 1984, 15-year-old Reesa Trexler is found murdered in her grandparents' home.

programme.title: Cold Case Files
programme.desc: In late 1983, the bodies of five people abducted from a local fast food restaurant are found brutally murdered. The main suspect is long believed to be a well-connected local man.

programme.desc: In Wisconsin, advances in forensic clay modeling help investigators identify a murder victim whose skin was stripped from her head, neck, and legs.

programme.title: Cold Case Files Classic

programme.title: Cold Case Files
programme.desc: A fire in January 2007 claims the life of WWII vet Bennie Angelo. A closer look at the crime scene reveals Bennie was dead before the fire, bumping an arson case up to homicide.

programme.title: Meet, Marry, Murder
programme.desc: Rebecca and Lee Cawthon enjoy inviting other people into their relationship, which is how they got together; after striking up a relationship with exotic dancer Alite, they also get intimate with her school friend Thad.

programme.title: Meet, Marry, Murder
programme.desc: After lawyer Chiquita Tate marries construction worker Greg Harris, the couple become the envy for their glamorous lifestyle; after a violent murder, Chiquita's criminal clientele is suspected, but the killer might be closer to home.

programme.title: Meet, Marry, Murder
programme.desc: Susan Fortune moves to Albany, Ga., for a fresh start after an abusive relationship ends; she marries Jake Embert, whom she met on a dating site; a few months of marriage ends in tragedy, demonstrating love found on the internet can be deadly.

programme.title: Meet, Marry, Murder
programme.desc: After meeting at a salsa club, Lulu and Ramon Sosa get married; after having financial difficulties, the relationship breaks down; the FBI are tipped off that one of them has hired a hitman and come up with an ingenious plan to catch the killer.

programme.title: Sleeping With a Killer
programme.desc: The 2013 murder of Dana Mackay, who was attacked by her husband's mistress and two accomplices while she was recovering from surgery in the hospital.

programme.title: Sleeping With a Killer
programme.desc: When James Barry breaks up with his girlfriend Melanie Eam in 2016, she retaliates by snatching his life away.

programme.title: Sleeping With a Killer
programme.desc: The story of Michelle Boat, who killed her estranged husband's girlfriend in a jealous rage.

Award-winning program anchored by David Muir, featuring unforgettable, character-driven true crime mysteries, exclusive newsmaker interviews, hard-hitting investigative reports and in-depth coverage of high profile stories.

Award-winning program anchored by David Muir, featuring unforgettable, character-driven true crime mysteries, exclusive newsmaker interviews, hard-hitting investigative reports and in-depth coverage of high profile stories.

programme.title: What Would You Do?
programme.desc: Using hidden cameras, host John Quiñones observes and comments on how ordinary people behave when they are confronted with dilemmas that require them either to take action or to walk by and mind their own business. Various scenarios are created that force people to make split-second -- and often surprising -- decisions, and variations of the situation (such as changing the genders, races or clothing of the people involved) are often featured to see if different reactions are elicited. Examples of situations on the show include a waitress being harassed by her boss, and a drunken valet trying to park cars.

Award-winning program anchored by David Muir, featuring unforgettable, character-driven true crime mysteries, exclusive newsmaker interviews, hard-hitting investigative reports and in-depth coverage of high profile stories.

programme.title: This Week With George Stephanopoulos
programme.desc: Former Clinton White House staffer and current co-anchor of ABC's weekday morning news show "Good Morning America," George Stephanopoulos and co-anchors Martha Raddatz and Jonathan Karl offer a look at current events with a focus on the politics of the day. Each week's show includes interviews with top newsmakers (including some of the nation's top political leaders) as well as a roundtable discussion, usually featuring journalists from ABC and other news organizations, of the week's happenings. Since 2008, the program has broadcast from a studio at the Newseum in Washington, D.C.

programme.title: ABC World News Tonight With David Muir
programme.desc: David Muir, former anchor of "ABC World News" weekend edition, tackles the responsibility of helming the weekday report of breaking news, taking the chair previously held by other well-known journalists: John Daly, Frank Reynolds, Howard K. Smith, Harry Reasoner, Barbara Walters, Peter Jennings, Charles Gibson, Bob Woodruff, Elizabeth Vargas and -- most recently -- Diane Sawyer.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: Fuller and Bumpus demonstrate how to take modern design techniques like flush-mounted glass and custom drip rails and convert those elements onto a 1986 Monte Carlo.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: Some project cars need every body panel replaced, so Fuller and Bumpus show how to work with new sheet metal panels on a 1963 Impala; they also find a running Road Runner to have some fun with.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: The guys bring in a vintage 1979 Jeep that is being sent to auction to give it a finished interior with carpet and panels; Jeremy uses a sewing machine to bind the carpet edges.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: Fuller and Bumpus bring in a 1981 DMC-12, and with the help of some DeLorean experts, they get the famous movie car running again.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: Fuller and Bumpus bring in a 1959 Ford Edsel and take out the stock transmission to put in an automatic overdrive and give the classic car extra shifting power.

programme.title: Car Fix
programme.desc: The guys pull apart a transmission to show the wear items, and install a performance clutch on a modified Chevy.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The crew tests the effects of running long vs. short rods on otherwise identical engines; they'll find out if long rods make more torque, if shorter rods' faster swipe makes a difference, or if rod length doesn't actually matter.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys find out which cheap carburetors produce the most expensive results; they pick a fight among remanufactured offerings from Edelbrock, Summit and Demon to see which will pump the most power into their 383 Chevrolet.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys flip things upside down to find out how much power might be left in the oil pan; a number of factors play a part in minimizing turbulence around the crank, but an $1,100 solution may not be worth the cost.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys try to shed light on whether iron or aluminum heads will deliver more power; they'll look at weight savings and heat retention's effect on cylinder pressure.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: A camshaft is causing issues, so the crew explores how changes to cam timing can help tune a power curve for high-end performance or low-end power.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys experiment with lash adjustments in an effort unleash more power.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys test whether a dual or a single exhaust system has more power.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys answer the question of whether a carb spacer produces more power.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys do a 4/7 swap on a big 572 to see if there's more power to be had.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys compare four of the most popular intake manifolds on the market.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys take 555 BBC and the Blower Shop then test the difference in power between gas and e85.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys dive into the lobe separation angle of the camshaft.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys explore the gains to be found for a sickly, low-compression 440.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys go through the basics of bringing a motor to the dyno cell.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The crew asks whether it's worth it to upgrade an ignition system.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys explore how header collector length affects power output.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys follow Freiburger's personal quest for 1,000 NA horsepower.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The crew investigates just how much power gets sacrificed to look cool.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys see if lightweight rotating assembly parts help make more power.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys test three sets of headers on a power-boosted motor.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys test whether tunnel-ram or cross-ram setups make more power.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys see which muffler works best for street-driving 1,000 HP monsters.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys break down two very different engines that make similar numbers.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: Steve Dulcich puts his Leaning Tower of Power to the test.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys test blower cams with their new 363ci small-block Ford.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: After years of dismissal, the guys give the Gen III Hemi a fair shake.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: Carb whisperer Steve Brule has tips to get a Holley 4150 running its best.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: Dulcich tests four aftermarket intake manifolds on his 225ci slant six.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys test which type of cylinder head delivers more power.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: We're battling the two most recent iterations of the 5.7 III Hemi.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The Windsor family finally gets its turn at an intake shootout!

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys debate if a solid roller camshaft is worth the extra money.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: We run our LS with factory exhaust manifolds and again with turbo headers.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys deliberately heat and cool fuel to see the difference it makes.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys find out if Max Wedge heads are really a worthwhile upgrade.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: We find out whether header wraps really do create more power.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: We test six manifolds with our old-school carb and our new-school 6.0 LS.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys see if exhaust cutouts do more than rattle passersby's eardrums.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The crew super-tunes every HP out of the 410 Windsor from the Disgustang.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys test out three low-buck cylinder heads on a 383 small-block Chevy.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys test how different carb features affect horsepower and tunability.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys challenge their previous findings testing single-pattern cams.

programme.desc: The guys see if too much oil pressure robs precious horsepower.

programme.desc: The guys try to boost an 800-horspower 572 up to a comfortable 950+.

programme.title: Episode 3
programme.desc: An amateur takes on the biggest names in poker in a high stakes cash game in Las Vegas. This week, a new rivalry emerges, as Lex Veldhuis and Alan Keating compete for a pot worth more than a quarter of a million dollars.

programme.title: Episode 4
programme.desc: The high stakes cash game continues in Las Vegas, with more than a million dollars now on the table. Entrepreneur Alan Keating continues to drive the action, determined to play every single hand, and make big moves.

programme.desc: It's the final session of this high stakes game in Vegas, and the last chance for the amateur ‘Loose Cannon’ to make a profit. Meanwhile, Hollywood actors Arden Cho and Jennifer Tilly play a hand worth $400,000.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The star-studded final table of the $1,500 Stud would see WSOP bracelet winners Men Nguyen, Ted Forrest, and Minh Nguyen looking to add more WSOP gold to their trophy case. Chad Brown would be eyeing his first WSOP bracelet as $111,440 in first-place prize money was up for grabs.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Nearly 800 rebuys would take this field size to 1,334 and a prize pool of over $1.26 million. The final table would be stacked with tournament veterans led by Daniel Negreanu, John Juanda, Mike Matusow, Lee Markholt, Paul Phillips, and Ram Vaswani as all eyes were on the $365,900 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The 831-entrant field created a $1.14 million prize pool in the first $1,500 No-Limit Hold'em event of the 2004 WSOP. Poker author Blair Rodman, and tournament regulars Joe Awada, Scott Epstein, and Kent Washington held seats at the final table, along with "The Crew" member Scott Fischman as the $300,000 first-place prize was up for grabs.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The biggest No-Limit Hold'em buy-in of the 2004 WSOP outside of the Main Event would attract 254 entrants and create a prize pool of $1,193,800. Barry Greenstein and Dewey Tomko fell short of reaching the final table, as WSOP veterans James Sousa and Paul "Eskimo" Clark headlined the final table ahead of Lee Watkinson, Thomas Keller, Martin de Knijff, and Young Phan as they chased the $382,020 first-place prize.

programme.title: Doubles Poker Championship
programme.desc: Thirty-two of the best professional poker players in the world buy in for $50,000 apiece, but there's a twist. They are then randomly paired off and compete as two-person teams that share the play on each hand. With $1 million in first place prize money at stake, which team will survive the gauntlet of clashing personalities and top shelf competition in a game that's usually a single-minded endeavor?

programme.desc: Comedy Central roast veteran Whitney Cummings gets the stage to herself in this debut special, which finds the young comedian riffing on a wide range of topics, chiefly the differences between men and women and how both behave in relationships.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Controlled Chaos
programme.desc: The ventriloquist comedian provides fresh, hilarious material with his favorite puppets; Walter, Peanut, and two brand new characters.

programme.title: Tommy Davidson: Illin' In Philly
programme.desc: This is Tommy Davidson, from "In Living Color", at his funniest! Check out this classic stand-up special and remember the 90s!

programme.title: Tommy Davidson: Takin' It To D.C.
programme.desc: Tommy Davidson shines in this classic 90s special. Whether he's talking about sex, the national anthem, cockroaches, or impersonating Prince & Michael Jackson, he's sure to make you laugh!

programme.title: Tom Papa: Human Mule
programme.desc: The everyman comic returns with his third hour-long stand-up special with a positive take on fighting for survival in an increasingly chaotic world.

programme.title: Tom Papa: Freaked Out
programme.desc: Famously upbeat comedian Tom Papa delivers a stand-up performance that includes his observations on the perils of raising daughters, and more. Executive produced by Rob Zombie.

programme.title: Tom Papa: Live in New York City
programme.desc: With a shiny happy exterior, an offbeat, demented interior and direction from Rob Zombie, Tom Papa’s “Live In New York City” attacks our hilarious attempts at happiness as life piles up around us. He jokes about becoming a parent, family pets, and boundaries for technology.

programme.title: Sinbad: Make Me Wanna Holla
programme.desc: A stand-up special covering the everything from the life advice his parents gave him to people with no talent having clothing lines and more.

programme.title: Sinbad: Where U Been
programme.desc: Sinbad hits the stage hard as he speaks truth to the burning subjects of the day, from poverty and politics to where he's been keeping himself.

programme.title: Fatimah Taliah: Nice to Meet Me
programme.desc: From the stress of student loans to anxiety and getting to know herself on lockdown, here is comedian Fatimah Taliah’s breakout comedy special!

programme.title: Larry the Cable Guy: Remain Seated
programme.desc: Larry the Cable Guy is back to "Git R Done" in his latest solo special from the Rialto Square Theater in Joliet, IL.

programme.title: Jenny McCarthy's Dirty, Sexy, Funny
programme.desc: Jenny McCarthy’s brand of naughty comedy gets a boost from popular female comedians, including Tiffany Haddish, on the realities of being a woman.

programme.title: Kevin Hart Presents: Lil Rel Howery - RELevent
programme.desc: Hart hosts the high-energy comic who riffs on his upbringing, raising kids, and public transportation, proving he can be hilarious and relevant.

programme.title: Lance Woods: Undeniable
programme.desc: Comedian Lance Woods brings his direct and unique takes on race relations, what he thinks about slave movies, and more on dating and modern life.

programme.title: Katrina Davis: Figuring It Out
programme.desc: Join comedian Katrina Davis as she shares her observations about coffee shop hygiene and the freedom that comes with discovering your dumbest self.

programme.title: Jim Gaffigan: Noble Ape

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Nottinghamshire at The Clumber Park Hotel, where general Manager Rajesh Saraf and his colleague Yuanee Tampoe believe all guests should be treated as gods.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Family Tree in Derbyshire, where owners Charlie and Sam Cameron want their guests to feel like one of the family. However, some of them are creeped out by the rooms.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit this week, the group heads to The Royal Hotel in Sheerness, Kent, where partners Sarah Lewry and Gareth Segrove believe they offer great value for money, but the guests have a lot to say.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The week's final visit is to Adhurst Yurts in Hampshire, where owner Alison Lubbock is on a mission to educate her guests to think green, but they question the provenance of her produce.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Sancton, Yorkshire and The North Star Club, owned by Carolyn Van Outersterp and daughter Galatea who hope their peaceful woodland cabins will win over the guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Friends Bed and Breakfast in Blackpool, Lancashire run by Luke and John Conway, who are the self-proclaimed unique selling point. But feedback from some leaves a bitter taste.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit of the week the group head to The Lincoln Holiday Retreat, which owner Debbie Grant has built from the ground up over the past twenty years. However, some of the guests think the décor is too dated.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The Chapel in Harrogate, North Yorkshire, owned by Mark Hinchcliffe and Heidi Donohoe, who pride themselves on offering something special in their converted chapel.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Heather and Sally hope their fussy cleaning regime will impress their rivals at Brockley Hall Hotel in Yorkshire. But there are problems in some rooms, and the breakfast puzzles the guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Alistair, who has fitted out luxury hotels including The Savoy, welcomes his rivals to his refurbished village pub, The Star Inn 1744, where his breakfast ordering system raises questions.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Michelle and Jason welcome their rivals to their luxury lodges at Croft Farm Park in Gloucestershire. The guests go canoeing but some struggle to stay afloat when someone sticks his oar in.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Steve and Tracy welcome their rivals to their bed and breakfast Harbour Vista in Poole, and most of their guests are surprised that it's not more lavish, when they realise they are staying in Steve's house.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: In Grosmont, North Yorkshire, at Grosmont House B&B, mother and daughter Selma and Roxy hope their personal touch and attention to detail will win over their competitors.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Monkspool bed and breakdast in Twyning, Gloucestershire. The establishment is owned by husband and wife Paulo and Suzi Lacey, who pride themselves on their top-quality mattresses.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit this week, the group head to Pymgate Lodge Hotel in Cheadle, where Romanian husband and wife Michael and Leda Ardeleanu believe their hosting skills will win the day.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to pub, restaurant and bed and breakfast The Stag and Huntsman in Hambleden, Oxfordshire, managed by South African chef Marius Pretorius and his partner Sarah Harris.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Weymouth, Dorset at The Somerset House Hotel, run by couple Adam and Holly, who hope their boutique rooms and BBQ breakfast will whet their guests' appetite.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Dawlish in Devon, where owner of The Knitting Hotel Belinda Harris-Reid and colleague Brenda Watson are hoping their guests get excited about all things woolly.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit of the week the group head to Stade Court Hotel in Hythe in Kent, where the owners, Sandeep and Vaishalee Chawla, have a hosting policy of treating their guests like a god.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Mandy McCready and her assistant Sam Gould welcome their rivals to the Goodlife Guest House, a family business in Harwich in Essex.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Ronnie and Steph Caird welcome their rivals to Inn at the Park in Aberdeen. where it is all about keeping it in the family. But one guest's culinary background piles on the pressure for Ronnie at breakfast.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Shauna and Fiona welcome their rivals to Ingliston Country Club in Renfrewshire. But Steve and Allard think the décor is dated, and a breakfast waiting game causes a storm in a teacup.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Steve and Allard welcome their rivals to 1692 Wasdale in the Lake District. Fiona and Shauna think it's picture perfect, but other guests face tricky technology and cleanliness concerns.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit of the week is to Blackpool and confident John welcomes his rivals to the Lynbar Hotel. He says his breakfast is the best in Blackpool and hopes his guests will agree.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Pencader, Wales and the School House bed and breakfast, owned by eco-friendly couple Jayne and Ian, where they hope their environmental approach will win over their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Cathedral 73 in Cardiff, managed by Neil Chidzey and Assistant Manager Jo Goodwin. Guests are wowed by the glamorous rooms, but the costs prove hard to swallow.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit of the week the group head to Leafy Suburban bed and breakfast in Northwood, where golfer Raj Kumar opens the doors to his home. However, Neil and Jo are not impressed with a surprise visitor.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The Wellington Inn in Hertfordshire where resources manager Felicity Rainbow takes a spiritual approach to hosting - but the `Welly' twist is not a hit with everyone.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at the Strontian Boutique in Strontian, Scotland, where Callum Pegg and his partner head chef Darren Anderson want to treat their guests to an exclusive stay.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the competition is to The Helix Hotel in Grangemouth, Stirlingshire, where host Nawaz Haq wants to show off his hotel, catering to the travelling businessman. Come morning, the group raises concerns over the breakfast banquet.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to The Black Boy Hotel in Sudbury, where hosts Kate Martin and sister Marie Carlton want their guests to kick back and embrace the historical surroundings.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The fourth visit is to The Lodge Bed and Breakfast in Cannock, Staffordshire, where hosts Lee and Marie Garnett are hoping their guests take to their homely BandB, but have they done enough to win?

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts at the Ship Inn in Dymchurch, Kent run by 21-year-old partners James Tindall and Jessica Walton, who believe age is but a number. Over breakfast, a frank airing of views sets the standard for the week.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Thompson Hall Retreat in Norfolk, run by mother and daughter duo Amanda and Becci. On arrival, everyone is wowed by the stylish shepherd huts with outside bath.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions are simmering as the guests head to The White House in Brighton.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Jacobs Plough in Bicester, Oxfordshire, run by manager Duncan Froomes and bar supervisor Ryan Hunt who like to mix banter with business. The criticism continues, with feedback that leaves the hosts praying for a miracle.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at stately home Anstey Hall in Cambridge, with father and son combo John and Johnny de Bruyne.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the competition is to clothes-free Clover Spa and Hotel in Birmingham where owner Tim Higgs hopes to convert his rivals to the joys of naturism.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to The Angel Hotel in Coleford, Gloucestershire, managed by Mark Davidson and Layla Caton.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to Higher Gitcombe, in Totnes, Devon, where owners Paul and Lynnie Jolly set out to spoil their guests rotten.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Four sets of camp site proprietors battle it out to be named best value. The competition begins at Amber's Bell Tent Camping in north Norfolk, a retro-styled pre-erected camp site created by artistic host Amber Wykes.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second day of the competition is at Park Farm Camping and Caravan Site in Norfolk, where husband and wife team Derek and Julie Nice are proud to show off their budget, family-friendly site.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to 500-year-old Layer Marney Tower in Essex, where posh hosts Nick and Sheila Charrington warmly welcome the guests into their luxury glamping lodges.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The fourth day of the competition is at the Foxhunter Park in Kent, where gregarious brother and sister team Jane Stacey and Russell Saunders own a luxury caravanning site that includes a bistro and entertainment.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts at Swallows Rest in Weymouth, Dorset, where owners Jane and Keith Smith are pulling out all the stops to win, but some of the feedback leaves Jane white as a sheet.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to The Burley Inn in The New Forest, where newlyweds Darren and James welcome guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit this week is to Hotel Montville in Redditch, Worcestershire, where host Ray Chowdhury hopes to win over his rival B&B owners.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit is to The Silverton in Shrewsbury where business partners Donna and David have split B&B responsibilities down the middle.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at The King's Head in Addlethorpe, with landlady Helen Coy and her bar manager and best buddy Emma Green pulling out all the stops to win.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to dog friendly Beck Hall in North Yorkshire, run by B&B newcomers Louise and Andy Macbeth.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to The Albaston in Torquay, owned by avid souvenir collectors Kevin and Julie Shadbolt.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to a specialist dance holiday venue, the Hotel Piccadilly, in Bournemouth, where owners Terri and Stewart Flett hope to get their guests in a spin.

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: In the semifinal episode, two celebrities are unmasked, leaving only the top three singers. Host Nick Cannon joins panelists Ken Jeong, Jenny McCarthy, Nicole Scherzinger, Robin Thicke and guest panelist Kenan Thompson. Between all 12 of the celebrity competitors on the show, they’ve amassed 65 Grammy nominations, 16 multi-Platinum albums, 16 Emmy nominations, nine Broadway shows, four stars on the Hollywood Walk of Fame and four Super Bowl titles. Singers will be eliminated each week, ultimately revealing his or her true identity.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: World-renowned chef Gordon Ramsay explores new territory in Ramsay's Costa del Nightmares, a four part series that sees him travel to Europe's holiday hotspots. Episode 3 sees Gordon travel to the stunning whitewashed mountain village of Gaucin, half an hour from the Costa del Sol. In a series first, Gordon is tackling a brand new up-market start up restaurant, La Granada Divino, it's only been open for 8 weeks but is already heading for disaster. Owned by architect Milan and former model Gina, they have never run a restaurant and have sunk their savings and retirement fund in to the place.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: World-renowned chef Gordon Ramsay explores new territory in Ramsay's Costa del Nightmares, a four part series that sees him travel to Europe's holiday hotspots. This final episode in the series takes Gordon to the Costa Blanca and a sleepy village that's home to Quelcutti's restaurant and bar, run by the Quelcutti family. Former London cabbie Del and his wife Sue emigrated to Spain 10 years ago with their three children: Joe, Terry and daughter Ruby. The plan was to retire and live the dream while using their retirement money to set up a business for their kids to run. Unfortunately, the kids are running the business into the ground.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Ultimate Cookery Course

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: World-renowned chef Gordon Ramsay explores new territory in Ramsay's Costa del Nightmares, a four part series that sees him travel to Europe's holiday hotspots. First up is Mayfair, with a prime location on the busy seafront in Fuengirola, Costa del Sol. The restaurant was set up 28 years ago by 68 year old Londoner Pat and her husband of 45 years, Jack. The good news is that Fuengirola is one of the only towns in Spain that has actually seen an increase in tourists since the recession with 1 and half million Brits visiting last year alone; the bad news is that Mayfair isn't benefitting. With thousands of hungry sun seekers right on its doorstep, the restaurant should be raking it in - but the place is totally empty.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: World-renowned chef Gordon Ramsay explores new territory in Ramsay's Costa del Nightmares, a four part series that sees him travel to Europe's holiday hotspots. Episode two sees Gordon tackle struggling Le Deck restaurant in Capbreton, a popular coastal town in South West France. British owners Tim and Debbie emigrated to France 28 years ago, where they met as holiday reps. Since then they've poured blood, sweat and tears into opening 3 ski restaurants in the Alps. With the arrival of their children, they set up home by the coast to enjoy the summer months together as a family. But unable to sit still, Tim launched Le Deck three years ago. Far from being a hobby, the restaurant has taken over his life.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: To make a MASTERCHEF-worthy duck dish, the top 14 junior home cooks must learn to butcher a whole bird, in one of the toughest mystery box challenges yet! Then, with huge stakes at hand, the cooks will work in pairs to make a dozen delectable cupcakes and the winning pair will have their recipe published in the all-new MASTERCHEF JUNIOR COOKBOOK. Find out who will succeed.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: To become America’s next Junior MASTERCHEF, the top 14 home cooks head to the great outdoors for a chicken cookout. Hungry campers at the KIDS CAMP MASTERCHEF will decide which dish reigns supreme, and the winning team’s recipe will be featured in Family Circle Magazine. The losing team must face a coconut cream pie pressure test that proves to be not as “sweet” as it may seem. Find out who’s MASTERCHEF dreams will go up in flames.

programme.desc: A sibling rivalry runs a Beaver, Pennsylvania restaurant into the ground. To resuscitate Levanti's, Chef Ramsay must first mend the relationship between its owners.

programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits Sam's Mediterranean Kabob Room in Monrovia, California, where he learns that the owner's seven children have had enough of their father's mismanagement.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: In this episode's challenge, the teams must match fish heads to their correct bodies, then prepare dishes to impress guest judge Michael Cimarusti.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: The contestants prepare American comfort food for the judges: Chef Ramsay, Chef Suzanne Goin and Chef David Burke. The winners sip cocktails aboard the American Pride in Long Beach.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs from Northern Ireland battle it out with their main courses. Derek Creagh, Brian McCann and Niall McKenna are determined to win, but which dish will take pole position? Will it be loin of lamb, rack of lamb with slow-cooked shoulder or fillet of Shorthorn beef with bone marrow?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Derek Creagh, Brian McCann and Niall McKenna deliver their desserts but which dish will earn top marks; strawberry and elderflower jelly with doughnuts and duck egg ice cream, poached rhubarb with lavender ice cream or brandy strawberry parfait with basil ice cream?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Only one chef can make it through to the finals to represent Northern Ireland and get the chance to cook at the banquet hosted by HRH The Prince of Wales, but who is going to come out on top?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: All the chefs want the honour of cooking for the Prince and today they begin their menus with the starters: a summer salad of pea mousse with pickled beetroot, ham hock with smoked cheddar mousse and chicken terrine with asparagus, onion and jasmine.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs from Wales - Richard Davies, James Sommerin and Aled Williams - pull out all the stops with their fish dishes: poached lobster with confit potatoes, sea bass with brown crab, and sea trout with apple, beetroot and smoked mussels.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the main course and rabbit, rose veal and venison are all dished up for `Great British Menu' veteran Richard Corrigan. Plus, one of the chefs is joined by `Eastenders' star June Brown for a fundraising challenge.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the dessert course. Will a strawberry and coconut dessert, a frozen white chocolate dish or apple and cherries come out on top? `Great British Menu' veteran judge Richard Corrigan will decide who goes through to the judges tomorrow.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is decision time for the chefs from London and the South East. One chef left the competition last time and only two remain. They will cook their entire menus for the `Great British Menu' judges, Prue Leith, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. This time they will be joined by celebrity guest judge, comedienne and writer Arabella Weir.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is finals week and 24 of the nation's finest chefs have been whittled down to just eight. Over the course of four hour-long shows, they will battle it out in the kitchen for the chance to get a dish to the Comic Relief Banquet. Actress Patricia Hodge, one of the stars of sitcom `Miranda', joins judges Prue Leith, Oliver Peyton and Matthew Fort to taste all eight winning regional starter courses.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs cook their fish courses. They are all vying to finish in the top three and still be in with a chance of cooking at the special banquet. Tensions are high but there are still plenty of laughs as new dishes are introduced under competition rules, including a Sicilian influenced dish called the `Cod Father'. Impressionist Ronni Ancona joins the judges.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Comedian Ade Edmondson tucks into the chefs' main courses to help decide which three will remain in contention to cook at the special banquet. However, the chefs are in for a major surprise as the judges deliver unexpected news about the day's competition.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's judgement day as the chefs not only learn the top three desserts but the judges announce the winning menu. `Fast Show' writer and performer Charlie Higson helps judge the puddings. Prue Leith, Oliver Peyton and Matthew Fort decide on the four winning dishes, but there is a problem - they are torn between two dishes for one of the courses.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the climax of the competition as the winning chefs cook at the Comic Relief Banquet at the Royal Albert Hall. Special guest and co-founder of the charity Richard Curtis welcomes guests - the unsung heroes of charity work, as well as those who have benefited from their help and some of the celebrities who have inspired us to do something funny for money.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The three chefs meet their surprise veteran judge and cook their starters. A dish celebrating childhood summer memories takes on a complicated courgette dish and a technically tricky take on the cucumber sandwich.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The atmosphere in the kitchen gets even more intense as all the chefs take risks with their dishes. Mike Reid, executive chef at M Restaurants in London, shocks when he pairs his fish with some highly unusual flavours.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's a smoke filled kitchen as the three chefs prepare their summer-themed mains in the hope of impressing the veteran judge. Selin Kiazim is in her element, cooking a feast inspired by the summer barbecues she enjoyed with her family.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: All three chefs are feeling the pressure as they attempt their technical summer desserts. With only the two highest scorers going through to the regional final, who will be sent home?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining London and the South East chefs must cook their entire taste of summer menus again. They're hoping to impress the formidable panel of Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort and restaurateur Andi Oliver.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs have been challenged to create outstanding dishes that capture a `taste of summer'. Their menus must reflect the tastes, smells and colours of everybody's favourite time of year.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the fish course and, with a seafood specialist in the kitchen, the competition is stepping up a gear. Tom is hoping he'll be able to elevate the humble mackerel to the standards required for the Wimbledon banquet.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With a refined summer barbecue going up against a traditional Cornish speciality and a historic Wimbledon related recipe, who will come out on top? Andy Clatworthy is using his passion for historical cooking to reinvent a dish.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: All three chefs are honouring Wimbledon and the British summer with their technically challenging strawberry desserts. Only the two highest scorers will go through to cook for the judges.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining chefs compete for a place in the national finals. To get there they'll have to impress the formidable panel of judges: Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort and restaurateur Andi Oliver.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Tom Parker is eager to impress with a salad that includes 10 elements. Meanwhile, Paul Askew, hopes his traditional techniques will triumph over his younger competitors, and Ellis Barrie is taking a risk with a creative cucumber and oyster starter.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the fish course and the atmosphere in the kitchen gets even tenser as the three newcomers begin to understand the perfection and skill the veteran chef demands. Ellis Barrie attempts to create the flavour of a summer barbecue.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the main course and the pressure is intense in the kitchen. In the hope of impressing the veteran judge, Paul Askew is serving an extremely personal main course based on his mother's favourite food.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Dessert is the last chance for the chefs to secure a place cooking for the judges and the pressure in the kitchen is intense. Paul can't afford to make any mistakes and is pushing himself with a technically challenging baked alaska.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining north west chefs must cook their entire taste of summer menus again. The guest judge is Greg Rusedski, former British number one, who understands the high standards expected at Wimbledon.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Returning banquet champion Tommy Banks takes on two ambitious newcomers, Danny Parker and Josh Overington. They start by finding out whois the surprise veteran judge and who will be marking their dishes.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The atmosphere in the kitchen gets even more heated, the three chefs are cooking their fish courses. Josh Overington creates a decadent dish inspired by the prestige of the Wimbledon Championships.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs are cooking their main courses and are all taking risks to try and win a place at the banquet. Danny Parker is trying to recreate the flavours of an American barbecue but the veteran chef is dubious about one of his ingredients.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Dessert is the last chance for the chefs to secure a place cooking for the judges and the pressure in the kitchen is intense. All the chefs are using unusual ingredients in their desserts.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining chefs from the north east must cook their entire taste of summer menus again. They're hoping to impress the formidable panel of judges Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort, Andi Oliver, and guest Judy Murray.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the Scottish regional heats and returning chefs to the competition Michael Bremner and Ally McGrath battle ambitious newcomer Angela Malik for a place in the national finals. This time they are cooking their starters.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The atmosphere in the kitchen gets even more heated and the veteran chef is expecting perfection from the fish course. Ally McGrath creates an inventive dish based on his summer memories of rock pooling in the River Tweed.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Angela Malik is in her element cooking a tiffin box based on memories of summer picnics. Michael Bremner is taking a huge risk, and Ally is creating an inventive dish based on a summer barbeque.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Dessert is the last chance for the chefs to secure a place cooking for the judges and the pressure in the kitchen is intense. Angela Malik is cooking a technically challenging dessert.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two Scottish chefs must cook their entire taste of summer menus again. They're hoping to impress the formidable panel of judges Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort and Andi Oliver. They are joined by guest judge Gary Parsons.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Determined newcomers Paul Croasdale and Nick Brodie take on returning chef Phil Carmichael for a place in the national finals. It's Phil's third time in the competition and this year he's determined to make it to the banquet.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The pressure in the kitchen is high as the chefs prepare their fish courses. Paul Croasdale is trying to recreate the elegance of Wimbledon with luxury ingredients such as king crab and scallops.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: For the main course, all three chefs are cooking Welsh lamb in the hope of impressing the judge. Phil is taking a risk with barbecued lamb and in an attempt to elevate a humble barbecue to banquet level, he's serving it with many accompaniments.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the dessert course and the last chance for the chefs to secure a place cooking for the judges so all three chefs are feeling the pressure. Phil Carmichael creates a tennis ball dessert that combines two British classics, Eton mess and trifle.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two winning chefs from the Wales region must cook their entire taste of summer menus again. They're hoping to impress the formidable panel of judges and guest judge Dan Bloxham, Wimbledon's Master of Ceremonies.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Pip Lacey's starter is a humorous take on the unpredictable British weather and features an unusual presentation. Ryan Simpson's dish represents an allotment complete with soil, while Nick Deverell-Smith's creation is a tribute to the precision cutting of Wimbledon's grass.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With the chefs hoping to impress, they each take risks. Pip Lacey combines lobster with strawberry in a tribute to strawberries and cream. Ryan Simpson's also using lobster in his recreation of a BBQ and has invented a technique to create his chips.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Ryan Simpson hopes to elevate a ploughman's lunch into a gourmet affair, Pip Lacey pays tribute to an unusual Wimbledon icon, while Nick Deverell-Smith looks to celebrate a meat which he thinks is underused, venison.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Dessert is the last chance for the chefs to secure a place cooking for the judges. Pip Lacey's pineapple dessert uses coriander. Nick Deverell-Smith also pays tribute to the pineapple, creating a dessert featuring a rice pudding made with couscous.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two chefs who've made it through cook their four courses again. They must impress the formidable panel of judges Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort, Andi Oliver and guest judge Jordanne Whiley, one of Britain's most successful wheelchair tennis players.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs meet their surprise veteran judge and cook their starters. Eddie is hoping to do better than last year, Joery is hoping to impress with a tribute to Richard Krajicek, and Tommy is creating a warm salad.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Joery Castel is combining mackerel and cucumber, and Tommy Heaney hopes his Murray Mound is a fitting tribute to Andy Murray's love of sushi. Eddie Attwell is creating five different strawberry elements to accompany the scallops in his dish.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Tommy Heaney's BBQ dish is a surf and turf combination, Joery Castel's aiming to recreate a more American-style BBQ and Eddie Attwell's taking a risk with an unusual meat.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Tommy Heaney's BBQ dish is a surf and turf combination, Joery Castel's aiming to recreate a more American-style BBQ and Eddie Attwell's taking a risk with an unusual meat.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two chefs who have made it through cook their four courses again. They are hoping to impress the formidable panel of judges, Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort and Andi Oliver, who are joined by tennis's greatest entertainer, Mansour Bahrami.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With finals week ahead of them, judge Andi Oliver first summons the chefs to Wimbledon to take a look at where they could be cooking if they win. The judges are joined by guest judge Sue Barker, host of the Wimbledon coverage for more than 20 years.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs must cook their fish courses but with some exceptionally high scoring dishes in the regional heats, each chef will need to deliver perfection in order to see off the competition. The judges are joined by guest judge Tim Henman.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is main course day and with only two spots remaining on the banquet menu, the competition is fierce. As the barbecues are fired up, all eight chefs are feeling the heat. The judges are joined by guest judge Gordon Reid.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is dessert day and with just one place remaining at the Wimbledon banquet, each chef is giving everything they have got. The judges are joined by guest judge Annabel Croft, former British number one and Junior Wimbledon champion.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the grand finale and the winning chefs must now cook their dishes at the banquet. Once in the kitchen, the chefs face the huge challenge of scaling up their dishes.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Competing for top spot are Danny Parker, head chef at Michelin starred `House of Tides' in Newcastle, who is back to try his luck in the competition again after being knocked out in the regional heat last year following a tense tie-break. He's taking on two newcomers: Dan Fletcher, protégé of Phil Howard, and now head chef at `Fenchurch' in the City of London, and David Coulson,who runs `Peace and Loaf' in Newcastle, which boasts 2 AA rosettes.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: After a tense starter course the chefs are all aiming for 10s with their unique fish dishes. David is celebrating a personal connection to the brief with his `My Cod I Bet Me Ma'am Has Seen Some Trotters', a tribute to his mum who has worked as a chiropodist. Dan's `For All Those Sleepless Nights' pays tribute to nightshift workers from the NHS with some bold but classic flavours while Danny's `Not All Superheroes Wear Capes' aims to give a taste of luxury to the hardworking staff.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Dan pays tribute to an icon of modern nursing, Florence Nightingale, while Danny is inspired by the founder of the NHS, Aneurin Bevan. David's dish is dedicated to the air ambulance staff who saved the life of his fiancé, and he even takes a trip to meet one of them.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the chefs' last chance to impress and tensions are high. Dan takes a risk with an unusual combination of ewe's milk and bergamot while Danny is determined to pull out all the stops with his complex dessert `Aunty Gwen's Chocolate'. David hopes to transform a childhood comfort classic into a show stopping dessert. Dan also takes a trip to meet Dr Ben Clarke who was working in the Royal London Hospital A&E during the London Bridge terror attack.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining North East chefs must cook their four-course menus again, but will they take on board their veteran's advice as they serve their `Feast To Say Thank You'?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Banquet champion Selin Kiazim, a rising star of the London scene renowned for her Turkish Cypriot fusion flavours, is back hoping to join the elite group of chefs who have made it to the banquet twice. She is up against James Cochran who's worked at some of London's toughest kitchens including 2 Michelin starred `The Ledbury' and Scott Goss from `The Twenty Six' in Tunbridge Wells, renowned for his use of local Kent ingredients.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs do battle for the fish course and the atmosphere in the kitchen is tense. Lobster is catch of the day for James whose dish is Caribbean-inspired. Scott is attempting to elevate a classic fish pie, dedicated to his mum who worked as a pharmacist in the NHS for 23 years. And Selin is taking a risk with a complex three-part fish dish featuring sardines, scallops and langoustines, as a nod to the purported health benefits of a Mediterranean diet.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Scott is showcasing rare-breed Tamworth pork to say thank you to the rare breed of people who work for the NHS. Selin is serving a complex duck dish using ingredients from all around the world to honour `Our Global NHS'. And James is presenting five cuts of goat cooked in five different ways, for his bold dish `Under The Knife'.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Selin puts her own unique twist on tea and toast. James creates a decadent coconut parfait accompanied by mango puree filled doughnuts for his dessert `Tree of Life' inspired by the coconut palm tree, the NHS and both of their contributions to our health. Scott hopes his elevated gypsy tart `Honey Bee Good' will secure him a place in the final.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining London and the south east chefs must cook their four-course menus again, but will they take on board their veteran's advice as they remake their `Feast To Say Thank You'?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Vying to be crowned champion of Scotland are three newcomers to the GBM kitchen. Lorna McNee is a former Scottish Chef of the Year and is renowned for her technical precision, gained from working at two-Michelin-starred restaurant `Andrew Fairlie'.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the fish course and the chefs are all out to impress. The heat is increased as all three serve their unique takes on lobster. Ross seeks victory with his dish `Lobster Aid'. Lorna's `Live Well, Live Very Well' features only three elements.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Across the country `Gardeners' World' presenters, from their own gardens and homes, give advice and share their knowledge to enable people to get the most out of their gardens. For further inspiration, professionals, horticulturists and hobby gardeners provide fellow green-fingered enthusiasts with useful tips and suggestions, no matter the size of garden or level of expertise. Whether it is creating depth in a small, backyard garden or how to make the most of the latest spinach crop with homemade pesto, presenters prove that the possibilities are endless for any gardener and garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don plants tender annuals for high summer colour, as well as sharing his tips for growing cherries and pruning blackcurrants. Arit Anderson discovers a paradise garden in Cambridge that has become a focal point for the local community.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost demonstrates how to build a rose arch, mulches his beds and plants a blackcurrant to train up a fence. Frances Tophill visits RHS Wisley in Surrey to witness the seasonal colour that heathers can provide in the winter months.

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Roxy and Steve live in Shrewsbury with their young children, but their garden has nothing exciting for children. It's so bad that when their children's nine year-old cousin came round to play, she complained there was nothing to do in the garden.

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Sheena and James have saved hard to create their dream garden. The only trouble is, despite being a gardening enthusiast, Sheena has run aground in her efforts to create a garden that is green and tree-filled but also a nod to their coastal area.

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Katie and Christian and their kids Max and Olivia live in Bitterne, near Southampton. They are suffering from a classic case of 'building work ruined the garden'. In fact, mum Katie calls it a `catastrophe' of a garden. Can Charlie and the Rich brothers save the day, despite having a budget of only £2,500? The garden also has to work as a space for both day and night. Christian works shifts, so he would like to use it late into the evening.

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Rhiannon and Chris need the team's help with their new-build garden. It's dull and boring with nowhere to sit, no shade, and it's dominated by two huge garage walls, which flank it on either side. Lee and Flo have a budget of £3,500 to work with.

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: In Stratford, Simon and Steve want a stylish garden with dramatic twists, suitable for the home town of William Shakespeare. Can the team come up with something that is stylishly modern with hints of Tudor heritage?

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.desc: Monty assesses the progress, successes and failures of his paradise garden. Elsewhere, Frances Tophill travels to Glasgow to meet a gardener whose hands-off approach to his garden has reaped rewards for wildlife.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don visits some of the most famous and interesting gardens in France. Here, he tells the stories behind France's important historic gardens. These include elaborate walled gardens designed to please the mistress - and then the wife - of a King, and magnificent displays of flowers and fountains that involved thousands of soldiers moving tracts of land and incited violent jealousy in another monarch.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don turns to the French love of food and finds out how this has influenced their gardens. He travels to some of the most famous `potager' or kitchen gardens, where vegetables and flowers are planted together in elaborate and beautiful displays. He also talks to gardeners about this style of planting which has been copied the world over.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels to some of the most celebrated artists' gardens, including the one created by the impressionist Claude Monet, who planted and painted his garden for half his life. Monty also matches the paintings to the garden of Paul Cezanne, as well as visiting several contemporary artistic gardens to see how the use of plants and trees has evolved into new and varied styles.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don uncovers the extraordinary stories behind Britain’s seventeenth century gardens.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don arrives in the eighteenth century, an age that gave rise to the landscape garden.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty visits influential gardens of the 19th Century, from royal retreats to the very first public parks.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty concludes his journey by looking at how the nation’s gardens have evolved over the last hundred years.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Brandon Simmons meets up with the legendary Guy Harvey to go fishing off the blue waters of Ft. Lauderdale.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Back in San Diego and with Rockfish on the mind, the LK crew fish new grounds and depths to catch these iconic Southern California bottom fish. Along for the ride is pro snowboarder and friend Dave Downing to round out this epic rock cod fishing trip.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: With the drastic changes in the Southern California fishery over the past several years, it has been easy to get fixated on targeting large Bluefin tuna and going all out on what many have coined "big fish" fishing. On this episode Ali and Rush take advantage of the many other opportunities this time of year has to offer and switch focus back to the basics, targeting smaller yellowfin, bluefin, and mahi on bait.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Thinking about a travel fishing trip of a lifetime? Check out what the participants of the first Local Knowledge-Casa Vieja group trip have to say about our favorite lodge in this special edition episode!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: What do you do when you fish for a living and get a day off? You go fishing! With weather on the forecast and a last minute cancelation, Rush calls long time friend Capt. Tony "Key Limey" Murphy to see what will bite before the cold front hits Key West.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: It might be cold and windy, but if you have trust in your guide the result could be an epic day of fishing! Rush steps up to the challenge and puts Ali on an incredible bite of mutton snapper while also checking another species off of Ali's bucket list!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: As season 8 comes to a close, Ali and Rush reflect on some of the more memorable moments on the water. From the Florida Keys to San Diego, Guatemala, and the Bahamas, the show has taken us on quite the adventures with more to come!

programme.title: Working Class Hunter
programme.desc: Kristy goes on her first turkey hunt in Missouri. Thanks to her father’s shotgun and her brother guiding her, Kristy is able to walk away with not only the highest of emotions, and the hunger to continue her new hunting lifestyle, but she was able to provide a meal for her and her husband from field to table.

programme.title: Working Class Hunter
programme.desc: After open-heart surgery, Seth wasn’t sure if he could hunt again. But with determination and a crossbow, he proves anything is possible, taking down a big Ohio buck. See how heart, grit, and passion lead to an unforgettable harvest. Don’t miss Seth’s inspiring comeback!

programme.title: Working Class Hunter
programme.desc: Managing a healthy deer herd is part of being a responsible hunter. Stephen, Candice, and Cliff take on the challenge of herd management by focusing on does. It’s not just about the hunt—it’s about preserving the future. Join them on this important mission and see how it’s done.

programme.title: Working Class Hunter

programme.title: Working Class Hunter

programme.title: FinQuest Outdoors
programme.desc: In the premiere of FinQuest, freshwater pro Ryan Miller dives into the world of saltwater fishing in Florida. Guided by Alex Burgess, Ryan tackles sailfish and tuna while mastering kite fishing. The adventure continues with his family as they enjoy a thrilling hydrofoil ride in Jupiter, Florida, blending fishing excitement with family fun on the water.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Si Robertson and Justin Martin from @DuckCommanderOfficial hunt with Lee Ellis and Kendell Golightly with @seekone8708 during the @realtree Max-7 pro staff Hunt in Louisiana. Lee, on his first duck hunt, is hoping to learn quickly and become the official goose guy of the outdoors while Uncle Si tries not to shoot the decoys!?!

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "In this special edition episode of Huckberry Homes, we travel to New York to get a rare look inside The Explorers Club headquarters. For the last 120 years, The Explorers Club has been the exclusive epicenter where legendary explorers come together to share some of the most incredible adventure stories ever told. From Roald Amundsen’s 1911 voyage to the South Pole to Sir Edmund Hillary’s ascent to the summit of Mount Everest to astronauts Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin’s history-changing 1969 expedition to the moon, the halls of this institution have echoed with tales of daring discovery and unparalleled human achievement. That’s why we’re beyond stoked to kick off our Huckberry x The Explorers Club partnership—featuring the Land, Sea, and Space Collection from an exclusive Whiskey Peaks collab and a badass grand prize. Tune in now to watch a tour so exclusive, it’s almost like being inducted into the club itself (minus the secret handshake)."

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "On this special edition of Huckberry Homes, we explore Floki Studios. Floki Studios is a renowned recording studio nestled in the rugged seaside of Iceland, offering artists an unparalleled environment for creativity and collaboration. Situated on the fringes of the Arctic Circle, this sanctuary provides a haven far removed from the bustling distractions of urban life. Surrounded by the untouched beauty of Iceland's pristine nature, Floki Studios is more than just a recording space; it's a haven designed to inspire and enhance the creative journey.Behind the scenes, Floki Studios thrives thanks to a dedicated team, deeply committed to the art of music. Jay Sweet, the Music Ambassador, stands out for his passion and advocacy for artists, embodying the studio's ethos of nurturing creativity. This partnership between Jay and the Floki Studios team exemplifies a unique blend of individual dedication and collective effort, providing artists with a space that fosters creative freedom and collaboration."

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: Capt. Blair stops in Steinhatchee for some Redfish and Trout with Leiza Fitzgerald from CCA Florida.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: With the drastic changes in the Southern California fishery over the past several years, it has been easy to get fixated on targeting large Bluefin tuna and going all out on what many have coined "big fish" fishing. On this episode Ali and Rush take advantage of the many other opportunities this time of year has to offer and switch focus back to the basics, targeting smaller yellowfin, bluefin, and mahi on bait.

programme.title: Local Knowledge

programme.title: FinQuest Outdoors
programme.desc: In the premiere of FinQuest, freshwater pro Ryan Miller dives into the world of saltwater fishing in Florida. programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: Ryan Miller targets exotic fish in Lake Ida with local guide Kevin Cannon in Episode 2 of FinQuest. Catching peacock bass and clown knife fish, Ryan also enjoys family fun with a skimboarding session in Jupiter, Florida.

programme.title: Tidewater Diaries
programme.desc: In this episode of Tidewater Diaries, Captain C.A. embarks on a captivating journey with offshore fishing YouTube sensation Captain Nick Stanczyk of StanzFam, renowned as the "Swordfish King." Together, they unravel the secrets behind Captain Nick's legendary status, sharing thrilling tales of swordfish expeditions on the open seas. The episode not only explores the intricacies of swordfishing techniques but also delves into the rich history of Bud & Mary's Marina. Through a nostalgic lens, Captain C.A. and Captain Nick vividly depict the marina's origins, capturing the essence of its enduring significance in maritime culture.
Kris and Flint Seymour hunt down a Kansas giant!
After filming his son kill his first 200″ monster, Kris Seymour chases big bucks in Kansas, Oklahoma and Canada.

This week we celebrate the 40th Anniversary of Lone Wolf stands and the man that started it all, the Lone Wolf himself Andrae D’Acquisto. As we take a look back at Andrae’s career, how it all started and where its heading after 4 decades, Andrae shares some insights on his hunting strategies and the equipment he has designed that made him one of the top bowhunters in the country!
Adam and Logan Hays chase big bucks in the Buckeye State!
Tarif Alkhatib hunts a couple giant whitetails in his home state of Texas!
Clay and Crystal Charlton of Take-Em Outfitters are after everything big in Alberta! Giant Lake Trout, Monster Black Bear and Big Muleys!

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 2: New Orleans, Josh links up with Mason Hereford (owner of award-winning sandwich shop Turkey and the Wolf) and then hits the road for some epic hog hunting, swamp fishing, crawfish and oyster harvesting, and exploring Louisiana’s only water buffalo dairy farm. It all culminates in one incredible feast featuring unique regional dishes prepared by Mason with the help of some local friends.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 3, Josh starts off in the Twin Cities where he meets up with Yia Vang, an award-winning Hmong chef and restaurant owner, bringing his family’s traditions and flavors to the American Midwest. As Josh heads up north to Duluth and the boundary waters, he’ll meet plenty of farmers and foragers—harvesting mushrooms, wild rice, and catching a few fish (and waves) along the way. It all wraps up with an epic feast hosted by Yia back in the cities.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: New. York. City. That’s where our host Josh Rosen kicks off his journey in Episode 4—and where he lived for 16 years and started up the surf-centric apparel brand, Saturdays NYC. Back in his old stomping grounds, Josh first meets up with the award-winning chef and Mumbai native, Chintan Pandya, currently blowing up the New York food scene with his unapologetic and authentic Indian cuisine (pro tip: try the goat brains). Next, Josh travels through the boroughs, heads upstate, and along the coast to source local ingredients—from sake brewers and pig farmers to catching fresh lobster just 100 miles from Wall Street. As always the adventure will end with a feast, right back in Chintan’s kitchen.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Hop in the float plane—a new episode of DIRT just dropped. The DIRT crew made their way to Alaska, “the land of earth, sea, and sky.” All feast, no sleep is the name of the game as Josh makes the most of Alaska’s abundant and legendary daylight alongside local guides, fishermen, and even a couple grizzlies. There’ll be plenty of time to hibernate in winter. But for now—join us—there are halibut to filet, rainforest ’shrooms to forage, and mountainside meals to cook up.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Atlanta is a city famous for vibrant art and tasty food, so for this episode the DIRT team went looking for the real people behind the scenes working to make this city so special. Josh meets celebrated chefs, barbers, farmers, and even a butter-wrapping machine dubbed André 4000 because he's "the second best 'wrapper' in Atlanta"—though special guest Killer Mike would probably take issue with that. Thirty years ago the real André announced to the world "the South got something to say," so tune in and listen up.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: "Hope you're hungry. In this episode, come along as we eat our weight in sushi and ramen, meet nori farmers and wagyu ranchers, and make some new surfing buddies along the way. P.S. if you're hungry for more Japan content, stay tuned for our next two episodes.In this episode of DIRT, the crew road tripped around Kyushu. The food culture in Kyushu dates back to the emperors of Japan, and the Black Current off the eastern shore has shaped the island's cuisine for centuries. The DIRT team followed that current up the coastline, surfing with new friends and tasting new flavors. And with each stop, we learned even more about how the traditions we keep can honor thousands of years of knowledge—and point the way to the future."

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: PCB’s white sand beaches are jam-packed with visitors soaking up sunand surf while Justin and Meredith chase schools of migrating tarponjust offshore. How often do those two worlds collide?

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: While releasing a defeated tarpon healthy after an epic battle is the ultimate victory, everything else is measured in heartbreak and degrees of failure. For Justin, putting Ethan on his first silver king requires patience and a tasty diversion by a local chef.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
